meanings.definition: To recover or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She restrives her lost necklace from under the bed.
meanings.sent2: He restrives his stolen bike from the thief.
meanings.sent3: The cat restrives its favorite toy from the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The detective restrives the missing evidence from the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist restrives ancient artifacts from the ruins.

meanings.definition: To bring back or revive something.
meanings.sent1: The rain restrives life to the dry desert.
meanings.sent2: Music restrives memories of the past.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion restrives youth in fairy tales.
meanings.sent4: Laughter restrives joy in a gloomy room.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise restrives hope in the darkest night.

meanings.definition: To make an effort to achieve or obtain something.
meanings.sent1: She restrives to reach the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: He restrives to improve his grades in school.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel restrives to gather all the nuts before winter.
meanings.sent4: The athlete restrives to break the world record.
meanings.sent5: The student restrives to understand the complex math problem.
